availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Robinson (Kenton County, KY, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Kenton County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Lee County, Virginia, native. Married to Charlotte Robinson. Father of William Robinson, Jane Robinson, Sarah Robinson, Lucinda Robinson, and Joseph Robinson. Served in the U.S. Army artillery as a private from February 15, 1814, to February 15, 1819. Farmer in Kenton County in 1850. Farmer in Kenton County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, p. 159A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, District 1, p. 377.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Mortality Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Western Reserve, p. 845.
Register of Enlistments in the U.S. Army, 1798-1914, Records of the Adjutant General’s Office, 1780’s-1917, NARA RG 94; Microfilm series M233, p. 194, p. 493 of microfilm.
Find A Grave, "James Robinson (1792-1869)," Memorial 11090866, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/11090866 (accessed April 7, 2020).
